metadata.title: CVE-2016-3495 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.13 and earlier allows remoteadministrators to affect availability via vectors related to Server:InnoDB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
